intro: Asparagus oxyacanthus, commonly known as the white asparagus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
